Temporary thread for tourney opponents stats
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Temporary thread for tourney opponents stats
By Lisa Shock on Saturday, November 15, 2003 - 08:29 am:

Ok, I am headed off for work, but thought I would start a thread for people to post lists of tourney opponents, so we can get started on a chart for the FAQ section.
Here is what we need:

Level of Tourney Letter,Name,Breed Name,Lif,Pow,Int,Acc,Spd,Def, all techs

So here is a fictional example:
C,Bob,Pixie/Lesione,445,125,226,357,456,123,Starlight\,Pat (note that you must use 2 slashes for 1 to appear in your post)

I can table them up tonight to start the charts, and will add my own at that time. and, yes, the lower level monsters are important for the chart, that's why I am asking early on for help.

*no tables please*

By Infernus on Wednesday, July 7, 2004 - 10:57 pm:

Okay, I've been looking at the list, looking for patterns (like I did in MRA2), and I think I've got it.

There appears to be 80 opponents per rank, consisting of 16 breeds, and 5 monsters per breed. This isn't guaranteed, but we can go with it until something pops up to disprove it.

I have calculated what we are [possibly] missing for rank E:
MewsNone
Garus2
AntlansNone
Lesiones1
PanchosNone
Suzurins1
TigersNone
PixiesNone
GolemsNone
SuezosNone
Mogis1
PlantsNone
ZuumsNone
HaresNone
Gitans2
Duckens1


And techs for one Plant and two Tigers.

That's all under assumptions of course, one monster could screw it all up, but it gives us some possible guidelines. I'll add to this as I count up other ranks.

That is what we DO have. Very out of routine. There are a lot more breeds this time, but the 5 may still stick, as Golem and Gitan suggest with their 4's.

By Petit-Trot on Wednesday, November 3, 2004 - 09:10 am:

I'm doing some clean up of the Miscellaneous section and since I don't know anything about this part, is this research done?

By Infernus on Wednesday, November 3, 2004 - 03:46 pm:

This "research" is something we sort of talked about yesterday PT. IMO, the tourney opponent list as a whole serves no purpose. It's a large, space consuming article. IMO, only the best and worst, as well as the special opponents should be listed. It serves no other real purpose.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, November 3, 2004 - 05:46 pm:

Well some people like to see what sorts of monsters they will be up against at various levels of competition. It's also something we have for every other game.

By Sientara on Saturday, April 2, 2005 - 04:00 pm:

Stats are in LIF-POW-INT-ACC-SPD-DEF order
Rank B Opponents:
Yas – Zuum/Gitan – 248-225-248-237-250-219
Skills - Tackle, Fireball, Tail Slap, Charge, Tear Bite, Break Shoot, Spin Tail, Spiral, Hero Kick

Morion – Mocchi/Hare – 240-238-227-233-238-243
Skills – Slap, Licking, Stretch, Kororon, Head Butt, PetalWhirl, Gotcha, MocchiCrash, MocchiRay, MocchiBoom

Nar – Garu/Hare – 241-251-227-243-248-225
Skills – WildSlash, Tornado, WildBite, FireCharge, SuperClaw, FireUpper, Beam, WildStomp, GoldenArm, Cyclone

Batista – Golem/Mocchi – 276-244-234-215-203-239
Skills – Slap, MegatonKick, Fist Shot, Rock Attack, AtomicPunch, Magnifist, Spin Punch, Golem Drop, Head Throw, Double Chop

Ninus – Ripper/Lesione – 247-229-240-264-246-225
Skills – Tail Claw, Mute Cutter, Slicer, SpinBlade, Dark Gale, Freeze, Hell, Tempest, SpinSword

Iselin – Dragon/Dragon – 296-290-268-239-233-277
Skills – D. Tail, Fire, D. Bite, Flutter, Trample, GraveThrow, Inferno, Wing Blade, Salamander, GravityZero
